subject: Sales
title: Death of a Salesman: Sales in Fiction
description: A micro-lesson that makes Death of a Salesman: Sales in Fiction usable.

hook.text: Arthur Miller's Willy Loman is fiction's most famous salesman. He's also fiction's most tragic.

buildup.text: Willy built his career on charm and relationships. When charm faded, he had nothing left.

discovery.text: The play exposed a dark truth: sales culture can destroy identity if self-worth is tied to numbers.

twist.text: Miller wrote it in 1949, but the burnout and identity crisis in sales are still relevant today.

climax.text: Willy Loman became a permanent warning. Selling can't be your whole identity or it breaks you.

punchline.text: The saddest sales story ever told is still being lived.

quiz.question: What warning does 'Death of a Salesman' carry?
options: Tying identity solely to sales can be destructive
